comments.body: Not against this, but any specific reason why BZ2, LZ4, ZLIB, ZSTD are turned off?

I am building RocksDB to support building cockroach from source. That  version only depended on snappy, that is why I built it with this configuration.

If we turn the other backends on, then I think we should build multiple versions of rocksdb and use a _mutex package to select the right backend. Is that how you would do it as well?  If so, let me know and I will add a placeholder _rocksdb_mutex package.

From this wiki page: https://github.com/facebook/rocksdb/wiki/Compression
It seems that the choice is dynamic. It defaults to snappy and one can override it. So I don't think a mutex is required here, since it is not exactly mutually exclusive in that sense.
Awesome, I will do a build with LZ4 (and maybe ZTD) and see if cockroachdb can compile and run. If it does, I will leave it like that.

I tried with cockroach locally and it worked. I am adding LZ4 and ZTD as I said before. 

It seem overkill to add BZ2 and ZLIB since we have better performing compression backends.
